conclusion: Induced current occurs when magnetic flux through the loop changes.
Magnetic flux changes when sides of the frame enter or exit the magnetic field.
Frame has side length \( l \), moves with velocity \( v \), and magnetic field width is \( d \).
Entire frame can be within the magnetic field since \( l < d \).
Stage 1: Induced current occurs as the frame enters the magnetic field.
Stage 2: No induced current when the entire frame is inside the magnetic field.
Stage 3: Induced current occurs as the frame exits the magnetic field.
Time to enter the magnetic field completely is \( t_1 = \frac{l}{v} \).
Time spent entirely within the magnetic field is \( t_2 = \frac{d - l}{v} \).
Time to exit the magnetic field completely is \( t_3 = \frac{l}{v} \).
Total time with induced current is \( t_{\text{total}} = \frac{2l}{v} \).
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is \(\boxed{\frac{2l}{v}}\).
